title: Jurgen Klopp confirms Mohamed Salah ankle injury after Liverpool star missed Manchester United clash
text:
Salah missed the game with an injury (Picture: Getty)

Jurgen Klopp insists Mohamed Salah had no chance of making the squad to face Manchester United on Sunday.

Salah was a noticeable absentee from the matchday squad that travelled to Old Trafford after struggling all week with an ankle injury he picked up before the international break.

There was good news for Liverpool, however, as Alisson returned in goal for the first time since August.

‘What can I say? Mo was not ready, so that’s how it is,’ Klopp said before the game.

Alisson returns for Liverpool (Picture: Getty)

‘He could not train with the team. I don’t know where it came from he might play. There was no chance. Maybe Wednesday, we will see.

‘Ali trains now two or three weeks with the team. It was clear he could play today.’

Advertisement

Manchester United had their own injury boosts with Anthony Martial on the bench and David de Gea starting in goal.

The Red Devils will deploy a back three against the Premier League leaders, but Klopp was not concerned with the absence of Salah up against a defensive United.

‘It’s a difference, but not a massive difference,’ Klopp said. ‘Mo offers some runs in behind. Adapt the system, that’s how to do it. We’ve played without him before.’

Man Utd XI: De Gea, Wan Bissaka, Lindelof, Maguire, Young, McTominay, Tuanzebe, Fred, Pereira, Rashford, James.

Liverpool XI: Alisson, Alexander-Arnold, Matip, Van Dijk, Robertson, Henderson, Fabinho, Wijnaldum, Mane, Firmino, Origi.
description: Liverpool star Mohamed Salah could play against Genk after injury forced him to miss Manchester United game, confirms Jurgen Klopp
